\subsection*{Interpretation within the $\nabla \mathcal{K}$ Framework}

\noindent
The identified nodes act as localized attractors/repellers in the informational field $\nabla \mathcal{K}$, with opposite polarities corresponding to coherent compression or rarefaction of informational flow. Their spatial distribution within $(l,b)$ and the observed sign structure of $\nabla \mathcal{K}$ are consistent with the emergence of nodal substructure anticipated by the Telascura model. Correlations with the kinematic observables introduced above (e.g., $v_t$) will be assessed in the next subsection to test whether high $|\nabla \mathcal{K}|$ regions exhibit coherent stellar flows aligned with the informational gradient.

\subsection*{Kinematic Coherence Around Telascura Nodes}

\noindent
We test whether proper motions align with the informational polarity of each node. Let $(l_n,b_n)$ be the node centroid and $(l_i,b_i)$ the position of star $i$. Using the small-angle metric correction,
\[
\Delta l_i \equiv (l_i-l_n)\cos b_n,\qquad
\Delta b_i \equiv b_i-b_n,\qquad
\hat{\mathbf{r}}_i \equiv \frac{(\Delta l_i,\Delta b_i)}{\sqrt{\Delta l_i^2+\Delta b_i^2}}\, .
\]
With galactic proper motion $\boldsymbol{\mu}_i=(\mu_{l*,i},\mu_{b,i})$ and node polarity
\[
s_n \equiv \operatorname{sign}\!\big(\overline{\nabla \mathcal{K}}\big)_n \in \{-1,+1\},
\]
we define the node-level metrics
\[
\Phi_n=\frac{1}{N_n}\sum_{i\in n}\frac{\boldsymbol{\mu}_i\cdot\hat{\mathbf{r}}_i}{\lVert\boldsymbol{\mu}_i\rVert},
\qquad
\mathcal{C}_n=\frac{1}{N_n}\sum_{i\in n}\frac{\boldsymbol{\mu}_i\cdot\big(s_n\hat{\mathbf{r}}_i\big)}{\lVert\boldsymbol{\mu}_i\rVert}.
\]
Angular alignment is assessed with the Rayleigh statistic. Let $\theta_i$ be the angle between $\boldsymbol{\mu}_i$ e $s_n\hat{\mathbf{r}}_i$, $z_i=e^{\mathrm{i}\theta_i}$, $R_n=\big|\frac{1}{N_n}\sum_{i\in n}z_i\big|$; then
\[
Z_n=N_n R_n^2,\qquad
p_{\mathrm{Rayleigh}} \simeq \exp(-Z_n)\!\left[1+\frac{(2Z_n-Z_n^2)}{4N_n}
-\frac{(24Z_n-132Z_n^2+76Z_n^3-9Z_n^4)}{288N_n^2}\right].
\]

\begin{table}[htbp]
  \centering
  \caption{Kinematic coherence per node. Larger $\Phi_n$ and $\mathcal{C}_n$ indicate motions consistent with node polarity $s_n$.}

  \begingroup
  \small % puoi provare anche \scriptsize se serve più compatta
  \setlength{\tabcolsep}{4pt} % spazio orizzontale tra colonne (default = 6pt)

  \pgfplotstabletypeset[
    col sep=comma,
    columns={ID_Node,l_mean,b_mean,mean_gradK,num_members,Phi,C,Z_Rayleigh,p_Rayleigh},
    columns/{ID_Node}/.style={string type, column name={Node ID}},
    columns/{l_mean}/.style={column name={$l_{\text{mean}}$ [deg]}, fixed, precision=3},
    columns/{b_mean}/.style={column name={$b_{\text{mean}}$ [deg]}, fixed, precision=3},
    columns/{mean_gradK}/.style={column name={$\overline{\nabla \mathcal{K}}$}, fixed, precision=3},
    columns/{num_members}/.style={column name={$N$}},
    columns/{Phi}/.style={column name={$\Phi_n$}, fixed, precision=3},
    columns/{C}/.style={column name={$\mathcal{C}_n$}, fixed, precision=3},
    columns/{Z_Rayleigh}/.style={column name={$Z_n$}, fixed, precision=3},
    columns/{p_Rayleigh}/.style={column name={$p_{\mathrm{Rayleigh}}$}, fixed, precision=3},
    every head row/.style={before row=\toprule, after row=\midrule},
    every last row/.style={after row=\bottomrule}
  ]{telascura_nodes_kin_coherence_min10_k6.csv}

  \endgroup

  \label{tab:NodeKinematicCoherence}
\end{table}


\paragraph*{Decision rule.}
We deem node $n$ kinematically consistent if at least two conditions hold:
$\Phi_n>0$, $\mathcal{C}_n>0$, $p_{\mathrm{Rayleigh}}<0.01$.


\paragraph*{Computational pipeline and data provenance.}
All kinematic metrics reported in Table~\ref{tab:NodeKinematicCoherence} are reproducibly derived with two short Python pipelines:

\begin{enumerate}[leftmargin=1.5em]
  \item \textbf{Cluster extraction \& memberships} (\texttt{membership\_stella\_cluster.py}).\\
  Starting from the Gaia catalog, we build a working set in galactic coordinates $(l,b)$ and informational intensity $\nabla\mathcal{K}$, rescaling the latter by a factor $\alpha_K$ to privilege informational coherence in the metric. We run a fast DBSCAN search (with an automatic local \emph{refine} on the largest cluster) and keep nodes with at least the chosen size threshold (primary $\geq 6$, fallback $\geq 5$ if needed to reach the target count).\\
  \emph{Outputs:}
  \begin{itemize}
    \item \texttt{telascura\_nodes\_refined\_min10\_k6.csv} — node catalog with $(l_{\text{mean}},b_{\text{mean}})$, $\overline{\nabla\mathcal{K}}$, members, and run hyperparameters.
    \item \texttt{star\_memberships\_refined\_min10\_k6.csv} — per–star memberships (columns: optional \texttt{source\_id}, RA/Dec, $l,b$, $\nabla\mathcal{K}$, cluster label); an additional filtered file with only retained nodes is also written for convenience.
  \end{itemize}

  \item \textbf{Kinematic metrics per node} (\texttt{compute\_node\_kinematics.py}).\\
  We merge the star–cluster memberships with the Gaia kinematics (\texttt{gaia\_codex\_with\_kinematics.csv}). Proper motions are used in galactic form $(\mu_{l*},\mu_b)$ when available; otherwise we transform $(\mathrm{pmRA},\mathrm{pmDec})$ to $(\mu_{l*},\mu_b)$ with \texttt{astropy}. If a unique \texttt{source\_id} is present in both tables we join on it; otherwise we align on rounded sky coordinates $(l,b)$ (6 decimal places), computing $(l,b)$ from RA/Dec when missing.\\
  For each node $n$ with centroid $(l_n,b_n)$ and polarity $s_n=\mathrm{sign}(\overline{\nabla\mathcal{K}})_n\in\{-1,+1\}$, and for member stars $i$ with proper motion $\boldsymbol{\mu}_i=(\mu_{l*,i},\mu_{b,i})$, we evaluate:
  \[
  \Phi_n=\frac{1}{N_n}\sum_{i\in n}\frac{\boldsymbol{\mu}_i\!\cdot\!\hat{\mathbf{r}}_i}{|\boldsymbol{\mu}_i|},
  \qquad
  \mathcal{C}_n=\frac{1}{N_n}\sum_{i\in n}\frac{\boldsymbol{\mu}_i\!\cdot\!(s_n\hat{\mathbf{r}}_i)}{|\boldsymbol{\mu}_i|},
  \]
  where $\hat{\mathbf{r}}_i$ is the outward radial unit vector from the node to star $i$. Angular alignment is quantified with the Rayleigh statistic $Z_n=N_nR_n^2$ and the corresponding $p$–value $p_{\mathrm{Rayleigh}}$.\\
  \emph{Output:} \texttt{telascura\_nodes\_kin\_coherence\_min10\_k6.csv} (columns: \texttt{ID\_Node}, $l_{\text{mean}}$, $b_{\text{mean}}$, $\overline{\nabla\mathcal{K}}$, $N$, $\Phi$, $\mathcal{C}$, $Z_{\text{Rayleigh}}$, $p_{\text{Rayleigh}}$).
\end{enumerate}

\noindent
In short, the decision rule
\[
\Phi_n>0,\quad \mathcal{C}_n>0,\quad p_{\mathrm{Rayleigh}}<0.01
\]
is evaluated directly from the rows of \texttt{telascura\_nodes\_kin\_coherence\_min10\_k6.csv}, ensuring a fully traceable link from raw Gaia astrometry to the kinematic coherence verdict for each Telascura node.

\paragraph*{Scripts used for the kinematic test (reproducibility).}
We report here the exact Python programs used to (i) run DBSCAN in $(l,b,\nabla\mathcal{K})$, export the star\,$\to$\,cluster memberships, and write the node catalog; and (ii) merge the memberships with Gaia proper motions and compute, for each node, the metrics $(\Phi_n,\mathcal{C}_n,Z_n,p_{\mathrm{Rayleigh}})$ that appear in Table~\ref{tab:NodeKinematicCoherence}. To avoid encoding issues, we use only ASCII in code and console messages; the informational gradient is referred to as \texttt{gradK} inside the CSVs.

\begin{lstlisting}[language=Python,
  caption=\texttt{compute\_node\_kinematics.py},
  label={lst:compute-node-kinematics}]
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from astropy.coordinates import SkyCoord
import astropy.units as u

# ---- required files ----
NODES_CSV   = 'telascura_nodes_refined_min10_k6.csv'
MEMBERS_CSV = 'star_memberships_refined_min10_k6.csv'
GAIA_CSV    = 'gaia_codex_with_kinematics.csv'
OUT_CSV     = 'telascura_nodes_kin_coherence_min10_k6.csv'

# ---- load nodes and set polarity from mean gradK ----
nodes = pd.read_csv(NODES_CSV)
nodes['s_n'] = np.sign(nodes['mean_gradK']).replace(0, 1)

# ---- load memberships and Gaia base table ----
memb = pd.read_csv(MEMBERS_CSV)
gaia = pd.read_csv(GAIA_CSV)

# ---- prepare proper motions in Galactic components ----
if {'mu_l_star','mu_b'}.issubset(gaia.columns):
    mu_lstar, mu_b = 'mu_l_star', 'mu_b'
elif {'pmra','pmdec','ra','dec'}.issubset(gaia.columns):
    c_eq = SkyCoord(ra=gaia['ra'].values*u.deg, dec=gaia['dec'].values*u.deg,
                    pm_ra_cosdec=gaia['pmra'].values*u.mas/u.yr,
                    pm_dec=gaia['pmdec'].values*u.mas/u.yr, frame='icrs')
    c_gal = c_eq.galactic
    gaia['mu_l_star'] = c_gal.pm_l_cosb.to_value(u.mas/u.yr)
    gaia['mu_b']      = c_gal.pm_b.to_value(u.mas/u.yr)
    mu_lstar, mu_b = 'mu_l_star', 'mu_b'
else:
    raise ValueError("Need (mu_l_star,mu_b) or (pmra,pmdec,ra,dec).")

# ---- robust merge: prefer source_id, else round (l,b) ----
if 'source_id' in memb.columns and 'source_id' in gaia.columns:
    # keep (l,b) from memberships; add PM from Gaia
    mg = memb.merge(gaia[['source_id', mu_lstar, mu_b]], on='source_id', how='inner')
else:
    # fallback: align on rounded (l,b); create them in Gaia if needed
    if not {'l','b'}.issubset(gaia.columns):
        if {'ra','dec'}.issubset(gaia.columns):
            c_eq = SkyCoord(ra=gaia['ra'].values*u.deg, dec=gaia['dec'].values*u.deg, frame='icrs')
            gaia['l'] = c_eq.galactic.l.deg
            gaia['b'] = c_eq.galactic.b.deg
        else:
            raise ValueError("Fallback on (l,b) requires Gaia to have ra,dec.")
    memb['l_r'], memb['b_r'] = memb['l'].round(6), memb['b'].round(6)
    gaia['l_r'], gaia['b_r'] = gaia['l'].round(6), gaia['b'].round(6)
    mg = memb.merge(gaia[['l_r','b_r', mu_lstar, mu_b]], on=['l_r','b_r'], how='inner')

# ---- per-node metrics ----
rows = []
for _, nd in nodes.iterrows():
    cid = nd['cluster']
    l_n = nd['l_mean']
    b_n = nd['b_mean']
    s_n = nd['s_n']

    sub = mg[mg['cluster'] == cid].copy()
    N   = len(sub)
    if N < 3:
        rows.append([nd['ID_Node'], l_n, b_n, nd['mean_gradK'], N, np.nan, np.nan, np.nan, np.nan])
        continue

    # local geometry relative to node centroid
    dl = (sub['l'].values - l_n) * np.cos(np.deg2rad(b_n))
    db =  sub['b'].values - b_n
    r  = np.hypot(dl, db)
    rhat_l = np.divide(dl, r, out=np.zeros_like(dl), where=r > 0)
    rhat_b = np.divide(db, r, out=np.zeros_like(db), where=r > 0)

    mu_l  = sub[mu_lstar].values
    mu_bv = sub[mu_b].values
    mu    = np.hypot(mu_l, mu_bv)

    # radial component and angular alignment
    mu_r   = (mu_l * rhat_l + mu_bv * rhat_b)
    dot    = (mu_l * (s_n * rhat_l) + mu_bv * (s_n * rhat_b))
    cos_th = np.divide(dot, mu, out=np.zeros_like(dot), where=mu > 0)
    cos_th = np.clip(cos_th, -1.0, 1.0)

    Phi = np.nanmean(np.divide(mu_r, mu, out=np.zeros_like(mu_r), where=mu > 0))
    C   = np.nanmean(cos_th)

    # Rayleigh statistic from unit-angle vectors
    theta = np.arccos(cos_th)
    z = np.exp(1j * theta)
    R = np.abs(np.mean(z))
    Z = N * (R**2)
    p = np.exp(-Z) * (1 + (2*Z - Z**2)/(4*N)
                        - (24*Z - 132*Z**2 + 76*Z**3 - 9*Z**4)/(288*N**2))

    rows.append([nd['ID_Node'], l_n, b_n, nd['mean_gradK'], N, Phi, C, Z, p])

out = pd.DataFrame(rows, columns=[
    'ID_Node','l_mean','b_mean','mean_gradK','num_members','Phi','C','Z_Rayleigh','p_Rayleigh'
])
out.to_csv(OUT_CSV, index=False)
print("Saved:", OUT_CSV)
\end{lstlisting}

\begin{lstlisting}[language=Python,
  caption=\texttt{membership\_stella\_cluster.py},
  label={lst:membership-stella-cluster}]
import os
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.cluster import DBSCAN
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.neighbors import NearestNeighbors
from astropy.coordinates import SkyCoord
import astropy.units as u
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# -------------- main knobs --------------
TARGET_MIN_NODES   = 10   # at least this many "valid" nodes
MIN_SIZE_PRIMARY   = 6    # members per kept cluster (primary threshold)
MIN_SIZE_FALLBACK  = 5    # fallback threshold if needed
ALPHA_K            = 2.5  # weight for gradK axis (2.0-3.0 recommended)

# quick tuning
TUNING_SAMPLE_MAX  = 20000
EPS_MULTIPLIERS    = [0.95, 1.00, 1.05, 1.15]
MIN_SAMPLES_CAND   = [6, 7, 8, 5]
FAST_PREFILTER     = True
PREFILTER_THRESHOLD_ROWS = 300000
GRADK_KEEP_TOP_Q   = 0.70  # keep top 30% by |gradK| on huge datasets

# recursive refine of the largest cluster
AUTO_REFINE        = True
MAX_SPLITS         = 3
EPS_SHRINK         = 0.75
MIN_SAMPLES_DEC    = 1     # local min_samples = mins_star - 1 (min 5)

# preferred gradK column names in the source file
GRADK_PREFERRED    = ['gradK_proxy', 'gradK', 'gradK_estimated']
GRADK_LABEL        = 'gradK'  # ASCII-only label for figures

file_candidates = [
    "gaia_codex_with_kinematics.csv",
    "gaia_codex_filtered_density.csv",
    "gaia_extracted_codex.csv"
]

# -------------- helpers --------------
def summarize(df_base, labels):
    tmp = df_base.copy()
    tmp['cluster'] = labels
    tmp = tmp[tmp['cluster'] != -1]
    if tmp.empty:
        return pd.DataFrame(), 0
    summ = tmp.groupby('cluster').agg(
        l_mean=('l','mean'),
        b_mean=('b','mean'),
        mean_gradK=('gradK','mean'),
        num_members=('gradK','count')
    ).reset_index()
    return summ, len(summ)

def count_with_min_size(summary, kmin):
    if summary.empty:
        return 0
    return int((summary['num_members'] >= kmin).sum())

def score(summary, kmin, target=TARGET_MIN_NODES):
    n_ok = count_with_min_size(summary, kmin)
    mean_members_ok = summary.loc[summary['num_members'] >= kmin, 'num_members'].mean() if n_ok > 0 else 0.0
    flag = 1 if n_ok >= target else 0
    return (flag, n_ok, mean_members_ok)

# 1) pick source file
selected_file = None
for path in file_candidates:
    if os.path.exists(path):
        df_test = pd.read_csv(path, nrows=5)
        if {'ra','dec'}.issubset(df_test.columns):
            selected_file = path
            break
if not selected_file:
    raise FileNotFoundError("No valid input file found.")
print("Selected file:", selected_file)

# 2) load + convert to Galactic (l,b)
df = pd.read_csv(selected_file)
coords = SkyCoord(ra=df['ra'].values * u.deg, dec=df['dec'].values * u.deg, frame='icrs')
df['l'] = coords.galactic.l.deg
df['b'] = coords.galactic.b.deg

# 3) pick gradK column
gradK_col = None
for c in GRADK_PREFERRED:
    if c in df.columns:
        gradK_col = c
        break
if not gradK_col:
    for c in df.columns:
        if 'gradk' in c.lower():
            gradK_col = c
            break
if not gradK_col:
    raise ValueError("No gradK column found.")
print("Using gradK column:", gradK_col)

# 4) base dataset
df_base = df[['l','b',gradK_col]].dropna().rename(columns={gradK_col: 'gradK'})

# optional prefilter for huge datasets
if FAST_PREFILTER and len(df_base) > PREFILTER_THRESHOLD_ROWS:
    q = df_base['gradK'].abs().quantile(GRADK_KEEP_TOP_Q)
    before = len(df_base)
    df_base = df_base[df_base['gradK'].abs() >= q].copy()
    after = len(df_base)
    print("Prefilter |gradK|:", before, "->", after)

# 5) quick gradK histogram
plt.figure()
plt.hist(df_base['gradK'], bins=100)
plt.title("gradK distribution")
plt.xlabel("gradK")
plt.ylabel("count")
plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("gradK_hist.png")

# 6) scaling (weight gradK)
X_raw = np.hstack([df_base[['l','b']].values, (df_base[['gradK']].values * ALPHA_K)])
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_raw)

# 7) k-dist based eps estimation on a subset
n = len(df_base)
sample_n = min(TUNING_SAMPLE_MAX, n)
idx = np.random.choice(n, size=sample_n, replace=False) if n > sample_n else np.arange(n)
X_s = X_scaled[idx]

k = 5
nbrs = NearestNeighbors(n_neighbors=k, algorithm='kd_tree', leaf_size=40).fit(X_s)
dists, _ = nbrs.kneighbors(X_s)
eps0 = np.percentile(dists[:, -1], 95)
print("Estimated eps (95th k-dist):", round(eps0, 3))

# 8) quick grid search to maximize kept nodes
best = None  # (score_tuple, eps, ms, labels, summary)
for em in EPS_MULTIPLIERS:
    eps_try = max(0.05, eps0 * em)
    for ms in MIN_SAMPLES_CAND:
        db_s = DBSCAN(eps=eps_try, min_samples=ms, algorithm='kd_tree', leaf_size=40).fit(X_s)
        summ_s, _ = summarize(df_base.iloc[idx], db_s.labels_)
        sc_s = score(summ_s, MIN_SIZE_PRIMARY)
        if sc_s[1] >= 6 or sc_s[0] == 1:
            db = DBSCAN(eps=eps_try, min_samples=ms, algorithm='kd_tree', leaf_size=40).fit(X_scaled)
            summ, _ = summarize(df_base, db.labels_)
            sc_full = score(summ, MIN_SIZE_PRIMARY)
            if (best is None) or (sc_full > best[0]):
                best = (sc_full, eps_try, ms, db.labels_, summ)
            if sc_full[0] == 1:
                break
    if best and best[0][0] == 1:
        break

# fallback if needed
if best is None:
    db = DBSCAN(eps=eps0, min_samples=max(MIN_SAMPLES_CAND), algorithm='kd_tree', leaf_size=40).fit(X_scaled)
    summ, _ = summarize(df_base, db.labels_)
    best = (score(summ, MIN_SIZE_PRIMARY), eps0, max(MIN_SAMPLES_CAND), db.labels_, summ)

(sc_tuple, eps_star, mins_star, labels_star, summary_star) = best
print("Selected eps =", round(eps_star,3), "min_samples =", mins_star, "kept nodes >=", MIN_SIZE_PRIMARY, ":", sc_tuple[1])

# 9) optional recursive refine on the largest cluster
labels_ref = labels_star.copy()
if AUTO_REFINE:
    df_lab = df_base.copy()
    df_lab['cluster'] = labels_ref
    for split_round in range(MAX_SPLITS):
        summ_now, _ = summarize(df_base, labels_ref)
        if count_with_min_size(summ_now, MIN_SIZE_PRIMARY) >= TARGET_MIN_NODES:
            print("Target reached before refine, round", split_round)
            break
        if summ_now.empty:
            break

        big_id = int(summ_now.sort_values('num_members', ascending=False).iloc[0]['cluster'])
        idx_big = (df_lab['cluster'].values == big_id)
        X_big = X_scaled[idx_big]

        eps_local = max(0.05, eps_star * EPS_SHRINK)
        ms_local = max(5, mins_star - MIN_SAMPLES_DEC)

        db_big = DBSCAN(eps=eps_local, min_samples=ms_local, algorithm='kd_tree', leaf_size=40).fit(X_big)
        new = db_big.labels_
        new_clusters = len(set(new)) - (1 if -1 in new else 0)
        if new_clusters <= 1:
            print("No useful split at round", split_round + 1)
            continue

        max_label = labels_ref.max() if len(labels_ref) else -1
        next_id = max_label + 1
        j = 0
        for i, is_big in enumerate(idx_big):
            if is_big:
                nl = new[j]; j += 1
                if nl == -1:
                    labels_ref[i] = big_id
                else:
                    labels_ref[i] = next_id + nl

        df_lab['cluster'] = labels_ref
        print("Split round", split_round + 1, "created", new_clusters, "subclusters from", big_id)

# 9.5) export full star -> cluster memberships
base_idx = df_base.index
cols_src = [c for c in ['source_id','ra','dec','l','b',gradK_col] if c in df.columns]
df_members = df.loc[base_idx, cols_src].rename(columns={gradK_col: 'gradK'}).copy()
df_members['cluster'] = labels_ref
members_out = f"star_memberships_refined_min10_k{MIN_SIZE_PRIMARY}.csv"
df_members.to_csv(members_out, index=False, float_format='%.8f')
print("Saved memberships:", members_out, "N =", len(df_members))

# 10) size filter and final node table
summary_use, _ = summarize(df_base, labels_ref)
if count_with_min_size(summary_use, MIN_SIZE_PRIMARY) < TARGET_MIN_NODES:
    min_size_eff = MIN_SIZE_FALLBACK
else:
    min_size_eff = MIN_SIZE_PRIMARY

summary_use = summary_use[summary_use['num_members'] >= min_size_eff].copy()
if len(summary_use) > 20:
    summary_use['score'] = summary_use['mean_gradK'].abs()
    summary_use = summary_use.sort_values(['score','num_members'], ascending=[False, False]).head(20).drop(columns='score')

summary_use = summary_use.sort_values('cluster').reset_index(drop=True)
summary_use['ID_Node'] = [f"T-Node-{int(c):04d}" for c in summary_use['cluster']]
summary_use['eps'] = eps_star
summary_use['min_samples'] = mins_star
summary_use['min_size_threshold'] = min_size_eff

out_csv = f"telascura_nodes_refined_min10_k{MIN_SIZE_PRIMARY}.csv"
summary_use.to_csv(out_csv, index=False)
print("Saved node catalog:", out_csv, "nodes =", len(summary_use), "size threshold =", min_size_eff)

# 10.5) optional: memberships only for kept nodes
kept_ids = set(summary_use['cluster'].astype(int).tolist())
df_members_kept = df_members[df_members['cluster'].isin(kept_ids)].copy()
members_kept_out = f"star_memberships_refined_min10_k{min_size_eff}_kept.csv"
df_members_kept.to_csv(members_kept_out, index=False, float_format='%.8f')
print("Saved kept-only memberships:", members_kept_out, "N =", len(df_members_kept))

# 11) quick map of node centroids
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
sc = plt.scatter(summary_use['l_mean'], summary_use['b_mean'],
                 c=summary_use['mean_gradK'], cmap='coolwarm',
                 s=60, edgecolor='k', linewidths=0.5)
plt.colorbar(sc, label=GRADK_LABEL + " mean")
plt.xlabel("l [deg]")
plt.ylabel("b [deg]")
plt.title(f"Telascura coherent nodes (>= {TARGET_MIN_NODES}, members >= {min_size_eff})"
          f" — eps={eps_star:.3f}, min_samples={mins_star}")
plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig(f"mappa_nodi_telascura_refined_min10_k{min_size_eff}.png", dpi=160)
print("Saved figure.")
\end{lstlisting}

\subsection*{Topological Segmentation of the Gradient Field}

\noindent
We rasterize the field on a $(l,b)$ grid, smooth it with a small Gaussian kernel,
compute the gradient magnitude $G=\sqrt{(\partial K/\partial l)^2+(\partial K/\partial b)^2}$,
and extract basin markers from the local minima of $G$. A watershed on $G$ yields
coherent basins whose centroids define the \emph{topological nodes}.
For each basin we report centroid, type (min/max/saddle from a local Hessian test),
area, star count, intra-basin mean values, and a simple persistence proxy
(border median of $G$ minus marker value).

\begin{table}[htbp]
  \centering
  \caption{Topological nodes from watershed segmentation on the gradient proxy (grid in $l,b$).}
  \begingroup
  \setlength{\tabcolsep}{4pt}% tighter columns (default is 6pt)
  \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.05}% a touch of vertical breathing room
  \footnotesize
  \pgfplotstabletypeset[
    col sep=comma,
    columns={ID,l_mean,b_mean,type,area_deg2,Nstars,K_mean,gradK_mean,persistence},
    columns/{ID}/.style={string type, column name={Node ID}},
    columns/{l_mean}/.style={column name={$l_{\text{mean}}$ [deg]}, fixed, precision=3},
    columns/{b_mean}/.style={column name={$b_{\text{mean}}$ [deg]}, fixed, precision=3},
    columns/{type}/.style={string type, column name={Type}},
    columns/{area_deg2}/.style={column name={Area [deg$^2$]}, fixed, precision=3},
    columns/{Nstars}/.style={column name={$N$}, fixed, precision=0},
    columns/{K_mean}/.style={column name={K\_mean}, fixed, precision=3},
    columns/{gradK_mean}/.style={column name={gradK\_mean}, fixed, precision=3},
    columns/{persistence}/.style={column name={Persistence}, fixed, precision=3, column type=r},
    every head row/.style={before row=\toprule, after row=\midrule},
    every last row/.style={after row=\bottomrule}
  ]{topo_nodes.csv}
  \endgroup
  \label{tab:TopoNodes}
\end{table}

\subsection*{Topological Segmentation of the Gradient Field}

\noindent
We segment the sky in galactic coordinates $(l,b)$ to identify topological basins of coherence in the gradient proxy. The pipeline is:

\begin{enumerate}[leftmargin=*]
  \item \textbf{Rasterization.} The catalog is binned on a regular grid in $(l,b)$ and we compute the per–bin mean of the gradient proxy (column \texttt{gradK\_proxy}). We also keep star counts per bin.
  \item \textbf{Smoothing.} The raster is convolved with a small Gaussian (user–set $\sigma$) to suppress pixel noise while preserving basin structure.
  \item \textbf{Gradient magnitude.} From finite differences we compute $g_x, g_y$ and the magnitude $G=\sqrt{g_x^2+g_y^2}$.
  \item \textbf{Markers (adaptive).} Basin seeds are local minima of $G$ found via a robust, three–stage search: pure local minima, $h$–minima, and a low–percentile fallback, with greedy thinning to enforce a minimum separation in pixels.
  \item \textbf{Watershed.} A watershed on $G$ (masked to valid pixels) yields labeled catchment basins.
  \item \textbf{Per–basin metrics.} For each label we report: centroid $(l_{\text{mean}}, b_{\text{mean}})$, node type (min/max/saddle from a $2\times2$ Hessian test at the centroid), area in deg$^2$, number of stars, mean raster value $K_{\text{mean}}$, an intra–basin variability proxy \texttt{gradK\_mean}, and a simple persistence score defined as the median $G$ on the basin rim minus $G$ at the marker.
  \item \textbf{Exports.} We write \texttt{topo\_nodes.csv} (per–node metrics), \texttt{topo\_basins.geojson} (centroid points; optional polygons), and \texttt{topo\_label\_grid.npz} (labels and grids for debugging).
\end{enumerate}

\paragraph*{How to run.}
All parameters can be set from the CLI; defaults match those used in the paper.
\begin{verbatim}
python topo_segment_gradk.py \
  --input gaia_codex_with_kinematics.csv \
  --grad-col gradK_proxy \
  --deg-per-pix-l 0.02 --deg-per-pix-b 0.02 \
  --sigma 1.5 --min-peak-sep 5 --min-region-px 30 \
  --export-polygons
\end{verbatim}

\paragraph*{Script used.}
Below is the exact Python script employed to generate the results and the CSV used by Table~\ref{tab:TopoNodes}.

\begin{lstlisting}[language=Python,caption={\texttt{topo\_segment\_gradk.py}},label={lst:topo_segment_gradk}]
#!/usr/bin/env python3
# Topological segmentation of the informational gradient in (l,b).
# Uses gradK_proxy explicitly. ASCII-only.

import json
import argparse
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

# deps
try:
    from skimage.feature import peak_local_max
    from skimage.segmentation import watershed
    from skimage.measure import find_contours
    from skimage.morphology import local_minima, h_minima
except Exception as e:
    raise SystemExit(
        "Missing scikit-image. Install it with:\n"
        "  pip install scikit-image\n"
        f"Original import error: {e}"
    )

from scipy.stats import binned_statistic_2d
from scipy.ndimage import gaussian_filter, binary_dilation

# optional fallback to compute l,b from ra,dec if l,b are missing
try:
    from astropy.coordinates import SkyCoord
    import astropy.units as u
    _HAS_ASTROPY = True
except Exception:
    _HAS_ASTROPY = False

# ===================== defaults =====================
INPUT_CSV    = "gaia_codex_with_kinematics.csv"
GRADK_COL    = "gradK_proxy"
OUT_NODES    = "topo_nodes.csv"
OUT_GEOJSON  = "topo_basins.geojson"
OUT_LABELS   = "topo_label_grid.npz"

# grid/segmentation defaults (CLI can override)
DEF_deg_per_pix_l = 0.02
DEF_deg_per_pix_b = 0.02
DEF_gauss_sigma   = 1.5
DEF_min_peak_sep  = 5
DEF_min_region_px = 30
DEF_export_polygons = False
# ===================================================

def parse_args():
    p = argparse.ArgumentParser(
        description="Topological segmentation over gradK_proxy in (l,b)."
    )
    p.add_argument("--input", default=INPUT_CSV)
    p.add_argument("--grad-col", default=GRADK_COL)
    p.add_argument("--out-nodes", default=OUT_NODES)
    p.add_argument("--out-geojson", default=OUT_GEOJSON)
    p.add_argument("--out-labels", default=OUT_LABELS)
    p.add_argument("--deg-per-pix-l", type=float, default=DEF_deg_per_pix_l)
    p.add_argument("--deg-per-pix-b", type=float, default=DEF_deg_per_pix_b)
    p.add_argument("--sigma", type=float, default=DEF_gauss_sigma)
    p.add_argument("--min-peak-sep", type=int, default=DEF_min_peak_sep)
    p.add_argument("--min-region-px", type=int, default=DEF_min_region_px)
    p.add_argument("--export-polygons", action="store_true",
                   default=DEF_export_polygons)
    return p.parse_args()

def ensure_lb(df):
    if {"l","b"}.issubset(df.columns):
        return df
    if {"ra","dec"}.issubset(df.columns) and _HAS_ASTROPY:
        c = SkyCoord(ra=df["ra"].values*u.deg, dec=df["dec"].values*u.deg,
                     frame="icrs")
        df = df.copy()
        df["l"] = c.galactic.l.deg
        df["b"] = c.galactic.b.deg
        return df
    raise ValueError("CSV must contain l,b or (ra,dec) with astropy available.")

def rasterize_mean(l, b, v, l_edges, b_edges):
    stat = binned_statistic_2d(b, l, v, statistic="mean",
                               bins=[b_edges, l_edges])
    cnt  = binned_statistic_2d(b, l, v, statistic="count",
                               bins=[b_edges, l_edges]).statistic
    return stat.statistic, cnt

def compute_gradients(field, dl, db):
    gy, gx = np.gradient(field, db, dl)
    G = np.sqrt(gx*gx + gy*gy)
    return gx, gy, G

def hessian_type(K, iy, ix, db, dl):
    nb, nl = K.shape
    iy = np.clip(iy, 1, nb-2)
    ix = np.clip(ix, 1, nl-2)
    dK_db_f  = (K[iy+1, ix] - K[iy, ix]) / db
    dK_db_b  = (K[iy, ix] - K[iy-1, ix]) / db
    d2K_db2  = (dK_db_f - dK_db_b) / db
    dK_dl_f  = (K[iy, ix+1] - K[iy, ix]) / dl
    dK_dl_b  = (K[iy, ix] - K[iy, ix-1]) / dl
    d2K_dl2  = (dK_dl_f - dK_dl_b) / dl
    d2K_dbdl = (K[iy+1, ix+1] - K[iy+1, ix-1]
                - K[iy-1, ix+1] + K[iy-1, ix-1]) / (4.0*db*dl)
    H = np.array([[d2K_db2, d2K_dbdl],[d2K_dbdl, d2K_dl2]], dtype=float)
    vals = np.linalg.eigvalsh(H)
    if np.all(vals > 0):  return "min"
    if np.all(vals < 0):  return "max"
    return "saddle"

def basin_persistence(G, region_mask, marker_val):
    rim = binary_dilation(region_mask) & (~region_mask)
    rim_vals = G[rim]
    if rim_vals.size == 0 or not np.isfinite(marker_val):
        return np.nan
    border_med = np.nanmedian(rim_vals)
    return float(border_med - marker_val)

# -------- adaptive marker utilities --------
def _thin_by_distance(coords, G, min_sep):
    if coords.size == 0:
        return coords
    vals = G[coords[:,0], coords[:,1]]
    order = np.argsort(vals)
    keep = []
    used = np.zeros(len(coords), dtype=bool)
    for j in order:
        if used[j]:
            continue
        p = coords[j]
        keep.append(p)
        dy = coords[:,0] - p[0]
        dx = coords[:,1] - p[1]
        used |= (dy*dy + dx*dx) < (min_sep*min_sep)
    return np.array(keep, dtype=int)

def find_markers_adaptive(G, mask, min_peak_sep):
    Gw = G.copy()
    Gw[~mask] = np.nanmax(Gw[mask])
    mins = local_minima(Gw) & mask
    coords = np.column_stack(np.nonzero(mins))
    coords = _thin_by_distance(coords, G, min_peak_sep)
    if coords.size:
        return coords
    h = float(np.nanstd(Gw[mask]) * 0.25)
    mins2 = h_minima(Gw, h=h) & mask
    coords = np.column_stack(np.nonzero(mins2))
    coords = _thin_by_distance(coords, G, min_peak_sep)
    if coords.size:
        return coords
    q = float(np.nanquantile(Gw[mask], 0.30))
    yy, xx = np.where((Gw <= q) & mask)
    coords = np.column_stack([yy, xx])
    coords = _thin_by_distance(coords, G, min_peak_sep)
    return coords
# -------------------------------------------

def main():
    args = parse_args()

    df = pd.read_csv(args.input)
    df = ensure_lb(df)
    if args.grad_col not in df.columns:
        raise ValueError(f"Column '{args.grad_col}' not found in CSV.")
    sub = df[["l","b", args.grad_col]].dropna().copy()
    sub = sub[np.isfinite(sub[args.grad_col])]
    if len(sub) == 0:
        raise ValueError("No finite data in gradK_proxy.")

    lmin, lmax = float(np.nanmin(sub["l"])), float(np.nanmax(sub["l"]))
    bmin, bmax = float(np.nanmin(sub["b"])), float(np.nanmax(sub["b"]))
    nl = max(2, int(np.ceil((lmax - lmin)/args.deg_per_pix_l)))
    nb = max(2, int(np.ceil((bmax - bmin)/args.deg_per_pix_b)))
    l_edges = np.linspace(lmin, lmax, nl+1)
    b_edges = np.linspace(bmin, bmax, nb+1)
    dl = (l_edges[1]-l_edges[0]); db = (b_edges[1]-b_edges[0])
    pix_area_deg2 = dl * db

    K_grid, N_grid = rasterize_mean(sub["l"].values, sub["b"].values,
                                    sub[args.grad_col].values,
                                    l_edges, b_edges)
    mask = np.isfinite(K_grid)
    if not mask.any():
        raise ValueError("Raster is empty; increase area or relax bin size.")

    K_s = K_grid.copy()
    K_s[~mask] = np.nan
    fill = float(np.nanmedian(K_s[mask]))
    K_s[~mask] = fill
    K_s = gaussian_filter(K_s, sigma=args.sigma)
    K_s[~mask] = np.nan

    gx, gy, G = compute_gradients(K_s, dl, db)
    G[~mask] = np.nan

    coords = find_markers_adaptive(G, mask, args.min_peak_sep)
    if coords.size == 0:
        raise RuntimeError("Still no markers after adaptive search; "
                           "try coarser grid or sigma ~ 0.8-1.2.")

    markers = np.zeros_like(G, dtype=int)
    for i, (iy, ix) in enumerate(coords, start=1):
        markers[iy, ix] = i

    labels = watershed(G, markers=markers, mask=mask)

    valid_labels, counts = np.unique(labels[labels > 0], return_counts=True)
    keep = set(valid_labels[counts >= args.min_region_px])

    l_centers = 0.5*(l_edges[:-1] + l_edges[1:])
    b_centers = 0.5*(b_edges[:-1] + b_edges[1:])

    rows = []
    features = []
    for lab in sorted(list(keep)):
        reg = (labels == lab)
        if reg.sum() < args.min_region_px:
            continue

        iy, ix = np.nonzero(reg)
        cy = int(np.round(iy.mean()))
        cx = int(np.round(ix.mean()))
        cy = np.clip(cy, 0, len(b_centers)-1)
        cx = np.clip(cx, 0, len(l_centers)-1)

        l_mean = float(l_centers[cx])
        b_mean = float(b_centers[cy])
        area_deg2 = float(reg.sum() * pix_area_deg2)
        Nstars    = float(np.nansum(N_grid[reg]))
        K_mean    = float(np.nanmean(K_s[reg]))
        gradK_mean= float(np.nanmean(np.abs(K_s[reg] - K_mean)))
        node_type = hessian_type(K_s, cy, cx, db, dl)

        if markers[cy, cx] > 0:
            marker_val = float(G[cy, cx])
        else:
            my, mx = np.where((markers > 0) & reg)
            if my.size:
                k = int(np.argmin((my-cy)**2 + (mx-cx)**2))
                marker_val = float(G[my[k], mx[k]])
            else:
                marker_val = np.nan
        persistence = basin_persistence(G, reg, marker_val)

        node_id = f"T-Topo-{lab:04d}"
        rows.append([node_id, l_mean, b_mean, node_type,
                     area_deg2, Nstars, K_mean, gradK_mean, persistence])

        feat = {
            "type": "Feature",
            "properties": {
                "id": node_id, "type": node_type,
                "area_deg2": area_deg2, "Nstars": Nstars,
                "K_mean": K_mean, "gradK_mean": gradK_mean,
                "persistence": persistence
            },
            "geometry": {"type": "Point", "coordinates": [l_mean, b_mean]}
        }
        features.append(feat)

        if args.export_polygons:
            mask_float = reg.astype(float)
            conts = find_contours(mask_float, level=0.5)
            if conts:
                contour = max(conts, key=lambda c: c.shape[0])
                poly = []
                for yy, xx in contour:
                    yy = np.clip(int(round(yy)), 0, len(b_centers)-1)
                    xx = np.clip(int(round(xx)), 0, len(l_centers)-1)
                    poly.append([float(l_centers[xx]), float(b_centers[yy])])
                if len(poly) > 3:
                    features.append({
                        "type": "Feature",
                        "properties": {"id": node_id, "kind": "polygon"},
                        "geometry": {"type": "Polygon", "coordinates": [poly]}
                    })

    cols = ["ID","l_mean","b_mean","type","area_deg2","Nstars",
            "K_mean","gradK_mean","persistence"]
    pd.DataFrame(rows, columns=cols).to_csv(args.out_nodes, index=False)
    print("Saved nodes CSV:", args.out_nodes, " (N=", len(rows), ")")

    gj = {"type": "FeatureCollection", "features": features,
          "crs": {"type":"name",
                  "properties":{"name":"galactic_l_b_deg"}}}
    with open(args.out_geojson, "w", encoding="utf-8") as f:
        json.dump(gj, f)
    print("Saved basins GeoJSON:", args.out_geojson,
          " (features:", len(features), ")")

    np.savez_compressed(args.out_labels,
                        labels=labels.astype(np.int32),
                        l_edges=l_edges, b_edges=b_edges,
                        K_s=K_s, G=G)
    print("Saved label grid:", args.out_labels)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
\end{lstlisting}

\subsection*{Topological Segmentation of the Gradient Proxy (patched)}

\noindent
We segment the sky in Galactic coordinates $(l,b)$ to extract coherent topological basins directly from the gradient proxy (column \texttt{gradK\_proxy}). The pipeline is:

\begin{enumerate}[leftmargin=*]
  \item \textbf{Rasterization.} The source catalog is binned on a regular $(l,b)$ grid and we record, for each bin, the mean of \texttt{gradK\_proxy} and the star count.
  \item \textbf{Smoothing.} The raster is convolved with a small Gaussian (user parameter \texttt{--sigma}) to suppress pixel noise while preserving basin shapes.
  \item \textbf{Gradient magnitude.} Using finite differences on the smoothed field $K_s$ we compute $g_x, g_y$ and the magnitude $G=\sqrt{g_x^2+g_y^2}$.
  \item \textbf{Adaptive markers.} Basin seeds are local minima of $G$ found by a three–stage search: pure local minima, $h$–minima, and a low–percentile fallback, with greedy thinning to enforce a minimum pixel separation.
  \item \textbf{Watershed.} A watershed on $G$ (masked to valid pixels) yields labeled catchment basins.
  \item \textbf{Per–basin metrics.} For each label we report: centroid $(l_{\text{mean}},b_{\text{mean}})$, node type (min/max/saddle from a $2\times2$ Hessian test at the centroid), area in deg$^2$, number of stars, mean raster value $K_{\text{mean}}$, an intra–basin variability proxy \texttt{gradK\_mean}, and two persistence measures: \emph{Pers.\ $G$} (median $G$ on the rim minus $G$ at the marker) and \emph{Pers.\ $K$} (median $K_s$ on the rim minus $K_s$ at the centroid).
  \item \textbf{Exports.} We write \texttt{topo\_nodes\_patch.csv} (per–node metrics), \texttt{topo\_basins\_patch.geojson} (centroid points; optional polygons), and \texttt{topo\_label\_grid\_patch.npz} (labels and grids for debugging). Optionally, a HEALPix map of \texttt{gradK\_proxy} can be exported.
\end{enumerate}

\paragraph*{How to run.}
Defaults reproduce the results shown in Table~\ref{tab:TopoNodesPatch}. Typical command:
\begin{verbatim}
python topo_patch_segment_gradk.py \
  --input gaia_codex_with_kinematics.csv \
  --grad-col gradK_proxy \
  --deg-per-pix-l 0.02 --deg-per-pix-b 0.02 \
  --sigma 1.5 --min-peak-sep 5 --min-region-px 30
\end{verbatim}
Optional outputs:
\begin{verbatim}
# export basin polygons in the GeoJSON
python topo_patch_segment_gradk.py ... --export-polygons

# also export a HEALPix mean map of gradK_proxy (does not affect watershed)
python topo_patch_segment_gradk.py ... --healpix-nside 64
\end{verbatim}
For \texttt{\textbackslash pgfplotstable}, if needed you can create a clean header to avoid BOM or stray spaces:
\begin{verbatim}
python -c "import pandas as pd; df=pd.read_csv('topo_nodes_patch.csv');
\end{verbatim}

\begin{verbatim}
df.columns=[c.encode('utf-8').decode('utf-8-sig').
\end{verbatim}
\begin{verbatim}
strip() for c in df.columns];
df.to_csv('clean_topo_nodes_patch.csv', index=False)"
\end{verbatim}

\paragraph*{Script used.}
Below is the exact Python script used for the patched run that generated
Table~\ref{tab:TopoNodesPatch} and the exported CSV/GeoJSON/NPZ.

\begin{lstlisting}[language=Python,caption={topo\_patch\_segment\_gradk.py},label={lst:topo_patch_segment_gradk}]
#!/usr/bin/env python3
# Topological segmentation of the gradient proxy in (l,b).
# Explicitly uses column 'gradK_proxy'. ASCII-only.

import json
import argparse
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

# deps
try:
    from skimage.feature import peak_local_max  # kept available
    from skimage.segmentation import watershed
    from skimage.measure import find_contours
    from skimage.morphology import local_minima, h_minima
except Exception as e:
    raise SystemExit(
        "Missing scikit-image. Install it with:\n"
        "  pip install scikit-image\n"
        f"Original import error: {e}"
    )

from scipy.stats import binned_statistic_2d
from scipy.ndimage import gaussian_filter, binary_dilation

# optional fallback to compute l,b from ra,dec if l,b are missing
try:
    from astropy.coordinates import SkyCoord
    import astropy.units as u
    _HAS_ASTROPY = True
except Exception:
    _HAS_ASTROPY = False

# optional HEALPix export
try:
    import healpy as hp
    _HAS_HEALPIX = True
except Exception:
    _HAS_HEALPIX = False

# ===================== defaults (PATCH) =====================
INPUT_CSV    = "gaia_codex_with_kinematics.csv"   # must contain l,b (or ra,dec) and gradK_proxy
GRADK_COL    = "gradK_proxy"                      # forced name
OUT_NODES    = "topo_nodes_patch.csv"
OUT_GEOJSON  = "topo_basins_patch.geojson"
OUT_LABELS   = "topo_label_grid_patch.npz"

# grid/segmentation defaults (CLI can override)
DEF_deg_per_pix_l = 0.02
DEF_deg_per_pix_b = 0.02
DEF_gauss_sigma   = 1.5
DEF_min_peak_sep  = 5
DEF_min_region_px = 30
DEF_export_polygons = False
# ===========================================================

def parse_args():
    p = argparse.ArgumentParser(
        description="Topological segmentation over gradK_proxy in (l,b)."
    )
    p.add_argument("--input", default=INPUT_CSV)
    p.add_argument("--grad-col", default=GRADK_COL)
    p.add_argument("--out-nodes", default=OUT_NODES)
    p.add_argument("--out-geojson", default=OUT_GEOJSON)
    p.add_argument("--out-labels", default=OUT_LABELS)
    p.add_argument("--deg-per-pix-l", type=float, default=DEF_deg_per_pix_l)
    p.add_argument("--deg-per-pix-b", type=float, default=DEF_deg_per_pix_b)
    p.add_argument("--sigma", type=float, default=DEF_gauss_sigma)
    p.add_argument("--min-peak-sep", type=int, default=DEF_min_peak_sep)
    p.add_argument("--min-region-px", type=int, default=DEF_min_region_px)
    p.add_argument("--export-polygons", action="store_true", default=DEF_export_polygons)
    p.add_argument("--healpix-nside", type=int, default=0,
                   help="If >0, also export HEALPix map at given NSIDE (no change to watershed).")
    return p.parse_args()

def ensure_lb(df):
    # ensure l,b; fallback from ra,dec if astropy is available
    if {"l","b"}.issubset(df.columns):
        return df
    if {"ra","dec"}.issubset(df.columns) and _HAS_ASTROPY:
        c = SkyCoord(ra=df["ra"].values*u.deg, dec=df["dec"].values*u.deg, frame="icrs")
        df = df.copy()
        df["l"] = c.galactic.l.deg
        df["b"] = c.galactic.b.deg
        return df
    raise ValueError("CSV must contain l,b or (ra,dec) with astropy available.")

def rasterize_mean(l, b, v, l_edges, b_edges):
    stat = binned_statistic_2d(b, l, v, statistic="mean",  bins=[b_edges, l_edges])
    cnt  = binned_statistic_2d(b, l, v, statistic="count", bins=[b_edges, l_edges]).statistic
    return stat.statistic, cnt  # (nb, nl)

def compute_gradients(field, dl, db):
    gy, gx = np.gradient(field, db, dl)   # numpy: rows(b), cols(l)
    G = np.sqrt(gx*gx + gy*gy)
    return gx, gy, G

def hessian_type(K, iy, ix, db, dl):
    nb, nl = K.shape
    iy = np.clip(iy, 1, nb-2)
    ix = np.clip(ix, 1, nl-2)
    dK_db_f  = (K[iy+1, ix] - K[iy, ix]) / db
    dK_db_b  = (K[iy, ix] - K[iy-1, ix]) / db
    d2K_db2  = (dK_db_f - dK_db_b) / db
    dK_dl_f  = (K[iy, ix+1] - K[iy, ix]) / dl
    dK_dl_b  = (K[iy, ix] - K[iy, ix-1]) / dl
    d2K_dl2  = (dK_dl_f - dK_dl_b) / dl
    d2K_dbdl = (K[iy+1, ix+1] - K[iy+1, ix-1] - K[iy-1, ix+1] + K[iy-1, ix-1]) / (4.0*db*dl)
    H = np.array([[d2K_db2, d2K_dbdl],[d2K_dbdl, d2K_dl2]], dtype=float)
    vals = np.linalg.eigvalsh(H)
    if np.all(vals > 0):  return "min"
    if np.all(vals < 0):  return "max"
    return "saddle"

def basin_persistence(G, region_mask, marker_val):
    # Ray-based persistence on G
    rim = binary_dilation(region_mask) & (~region_mask)
    rim_vals = G[rim]
    if rim_vals.size == 0 or not np.isfinite(marker_val):
        return np.nan
    border_med = np.nanmedian(rim_vals)
    return float(border_med - marker_val)

def _thin_by_distance(coords, G, min_sep):
    # greedy thinning: prefer deeper minima (lower G)
    if coords.size == 0:
        return coords
    vals = G[coords[:,0], coords[:,1]]
    order = np.argsort(vals)
    keep = []
    used = np.zeros(len(coords), dtype=bool)
    for j in order:
        if used[j]:
            continue
        p = coords[j]
        keep.append(p)
        dy = coords[:,0] - p[0]
        dx = coords[:,1] - p[1]
        used |= (dy*dy + dx*dx) < (min_sep*min_sep)
    return np.array(keep, dtype=int)

def find_markers_adaptive(G, mask, min_peak_sep):
    Gw = G.copy()
    Gw[~mask] = np.nanmax(Gw[mask])
    mins = local_minima(Gw) & mask
    coords = np.column_stack(np.nonzero(mins))
    coords = _thin_by_distance(coords, G, min_peak_sep)
    if coords.size:
        return coords
    h = float(np.nanstd(Gw[mask]) * 0.25)
    mins2 = h_minima(Gw, h=h) & mask
    coords = np.column_stack(np.nonzero(mins2))
    coords = _thin_by_distance(coords, G, min_peak_sep)
    if coords.size:
        return coords
    q = float(np.nanquantile(Gw[mask], 0.30))
    yy, xx = np.where((Gw <= q) & mask)
    coords = np.column_stack([yy, xx])
    coords = _thin_by_distance(coords, G, min_peak_sep)
    return coords

def export_healpix_mean(l_deg, b_deg, v, nside,
                        out_fits="gradK_proxy_healpix_patch.fits",
                        out_png="gradK_proxy_healpix_patch.png"):
    if not _HAS_HEALPIX:
        raise RuntimeError("healpy not available. Install with: pip install healpy")
    npix = hp.nside2npix(nside)
    theta = np.radians(90.0 - l_deg.astype(float)*0.0 - b_deg.astype(float))  # colat = 90 - b
    phi   = np.radians(l_deg.astype(float) % 360.0)
    ipix = hp.ang2pix(nside, theta, phi, nest=False)
    w = np.isfinite(v)
    cnt = np.bincount(ipix[w], minlength=npix)
    s   = np.bincount(ipix[w], weights=v[w], minlength=npix)
    m   = np.full(npix, np.nan, dtype=float)
    ok  = cnt > 0
    m[ok] = s[ok] / cnt[ok]
    hp.write_map(out_fits, m, overwrite=True)
    try:
        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
        plt.figure(figsize=(8,5))
        hp.mollview(m, title=f"gradK_proxy (NSIDE={nside})", unit="mean", norm="hist")
        hp.graticule()
        plt.savefig(out_png, dpi=160, bbox_inches="tight")
        plt.close()
    except Exception:
        pass
    return out_fits, out_png

def main():
    args = parse_args()

    # load and check
    df = pd.read_csv(args.input)
    df = ensure_lb(df)
    if args.grad_col not in df.columns:
        raise ValueError(f"Column '{args.grad_col}' not found in CSV.")
    sub = df[["l","b", args.grad_col]].dropna().copy()
    sub = sub[np.isfinite(sub[args.grad_col])]
    if len(sub) == 0:
        raise ValueError("No finite data in gradK_proxy.")

    # optional HEALPix export (does not affect watershed)
    if args.healpix_nside and args.healpix_nside > 0:
        try:
            export_healpix_mean(sub["l"].values, sub["b"].values,
                                sub[args.grad_col].values,
                                nside=args.healpix_nside)
            print("Saved HEALPix products for gradK_proxy (NSIDE=", args.healpix_nside, ")")
        except Exception as e:
            print("HEALPix export failed:", e)

    # build grid
    lmin, lmax = float(np.nanmin(sub["l"])), float(np.nanmax(sub["l"]))
    bmin, bmax = float(np.nanmin(sub["b"])), float(np.nanmax(sub["b"]))
    nl = max(2, int(np.ceil((lmax - lmin)/args.deg_per_pix_l)))
    nb = max(2, int(np.ceil((bmax - bmin)/args.deg_per_pix_b)))
    l_edges = np.linspace(lmin, lmax, nl+1)
    b_edges = np.linspace(bmin, bmax, nb+1)
    dl = (l_edges[1]-l_edges[0])
    db = (b_edges[1]-b_edges[0])
    pix_area_deg2 = dl * db

    # rasterize mean of gradK_proxy and star counts
    K_grid, N_grid = rasterize_mean(sub["l"].values, sub["b"].values,
                                    sub[args.grad_col].values, l_edges, b_edges)
    mask = np.isfinite(K_grid)
    if not mask.any():
        raise ValueError("Raster is empty; increase area or relax bin size.")

    # smoothing with fill for NaN
    K_s = K_grid.copy()
    K_s[~mask] = np.nan
    fill = float(np.nanmedian(K_s[mask]))
    K_s[~mask] = fill
    K_s = gaussian_filter(K_s, sigma=args.sigma)
    K_s[~mask] = np.nan

    # gradients on smoothed raster
    gx, gy, G = compute_gradients(K_s, dl, db)
    G[~mask] = np.nan

    # markers: adaptive search of minima in G
    coords = find_markers_adaptive(G, mask, args.min_peak_sep)
    if coords.size == 0:
        raise RuntimeError("Still no markers after adaptive search; try coarser grid or sigma ~ 0.8-1.2.")

    markers = np.zeros_like(G, dtype=int)
    for i, (iy, ix) in enumerate(coords, start=1):
        markers[iy, ix] = i

    # watershed segmentation on G
    labels = watershed(G, markers=markers, mask=mask)

    # filter tiny basins
    valid_labels, counts = np.unique(labels[labels > 0], return_counts=True)
    keep = set(valid_labels[counts >= args.min_region_px])

    # cell centers
    l_centers = 0.5*(l_edges[:-1] + l_edges[1:])
    b_centers = 0.5*(b_edges[:-1] + b_edges[1:])

    rows = []
    features = []
    for lab in sorted(list(keep)):
        reg = (labels == lab)
        if reg.sum() < args.min_region_px:
            continue

        iy, ix = np.nonzero(reg)
        cy = int(np.round(iy.mean()))
        cx = int(np.round(ix.mean()))
        cy = np.clip(cy, 0, len(b_centers)-1)
        cx = np.clip(cx, 0, len(l_centers)-1)

        l_mean = float(l_centers[cx])
        b_mean = float(b_centers[cy])

        area_deg2 = float(reg.sum() * pix_area_deg2)
        Nstars    = float(np.nansum(N_grid[reg]))
        K_mean    = float(np.nanmean(K_s[reg]))
        gradK_mean= float(np.nanmean(np.abs(K_s[reg] - K_mean)))  # variability proxy

        node_type = hessian_type(K_s, cy, cx, db, dl)

        # marker value in G for persistence on G
        if markers[cy, cx] > 0:
            marker_val = float(G[cy, cx])
        else:
            my, mx = np.where((markers > 0) & reg)
            if my.size:
                k = int(np.argmin((my-cy)**2 + (mx-cx)**2))
                marker_val = float(G[my[k], mx[k]])
            else:
                marker_val = np.nan
        persistence = basin_persistence(G, reg, marker_val)

        # NEW: persistence on K (median border of K_s minus K at center)
        rim_mask = binary_dilation(reg) & (~reg)
        K_border_med = float(np.nanmedian(K_s[rim_mask])) if np.any(rim_mask) else np.nan
        K_center = float(K_s[cy, cx]) if np.isfinite(K_s[cy, cx]) else np.nan
        persistence_K = K_border_med - K_center  # >0 means deeper basin in K

        node_id = f"T-Topo-{lab:04d}"
        rows.append([node_id, l_mean, b_mean, node_type,
                     area_deg2, Nstars, K_mean, gradK_mean, persistence, persistence_K])

        feat = {
            "type": "Feature",
            "properties": {
                "id": node_id,
                "type": node_type,
                "area_deg2": area_deg2,
                "Nstars": Nstars,
                "K_mean": K_mean,
                "gradK_mean": gradK_mean,
                "persistence": persistence,
                "persistence_K": persistence_K
            },
            "geometry": {"type": "Point", "coordinates": [l_mean, b_mean]}
        }
        features.append(feat)

        if args.export_polygons:
            mask_float = reg.astype(float)
            conts = find_contours(mask_float, level=0.5)
            if conts:
                contour = max(conts, key=lambda c: c.shape[0])
                poly = []
                for yy, xx in contour:
                    yy = np.clip(int(round(yy)), 0, len(b_centers)-1)
                    xx = np.clip(int(round(xx)), 0, len(l_centers)-1)
                    poly.append([float(l_centers[xx]), float(b_centers[yy])])
                if len(poly) > 3:
                    features.append({
                        "type": "Feature",
                        "properties": {"id": node_id, "kind": "polygon"},
                        "geometry": {"type": "Polygon", "coordinates": [poly]}
                    })

    # save CSV (PATCH columns include persistence_K)
    cols = ["ID","l_mean","b_mean","type","area_deg2","Nstars",
            "K_mean","gradK_mean","persistence","persistence_K"]
    pd.DataFrame(rows, columns=cols).to_csv(args.out_nodes, index=False)
    print("Saved nodes CSV:", args.out_nodes, " (N=", len(rows), ")")

    # save GeoJSON
    gj = {"type": "FeatureCollection", "features": features,
          "crs": {"type":"name","properties":{"name":"galactic_l_b_deg"}}}
    with open(args.out_geojson, "w", encoding="utf-8") as f:
        json.dump(gj, f)
    print("Saved basins GeoJSON:", args.out_geojson, " (features:", len(features), ")")

    # save label grid
    np.savez_compressed(args.out_labels,
                        labels=labels.astype(np.int32),
                        l_edges=l_edges, b_edges=b_edges,
                        K_s=K_s, G=G)
    print("Saved label grid:", args.out_labels)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
\end{lstlisting}

\subsection*{QC Map: Topological Centroids Colored by Persistence $K$ (patched)}

\noindent
As a quick quality check we visualize the centroids of the topological basins in Galactic coordinates $(l,b)$.
Color encodes persistence $K$ (median $K_s$ on the basin rim minus $K_s$ at the centroid; $>0$ means a deeper basin),
and marker size is proportional to basin area (deg$^2$). Data come from
\texttt{topo\_nodes\_patch.csv} (columns \texttt{l\_mean}, \texttt{b\_mean}, \texttt{area\_deg2}, \texttt{persistence\_K}).

\end{verbatim}

\subsection*{Graph integration of topological basins (v1)}

\noindent
We convert the patched topological products into a lightweight graph for the
global Telascura map. Nodes are the watershed basins (centroids in galactic
coordinates), and edges connect basins that are adjacent in the label grid.

\begin{enumerate}[leftmargin=*]
  \item \textbf{Inputs.} \texttt{topo\_nodes\_patch.csv} (per-basin metrics) and
  \texttt{topo\_label\_grid\_patch.npz} (integer labels, grid edges, smoothed fields).
  \item \textbf{Adjacency.} Two basins are linked if their integer labels touch
  in the raster (4-neighborhood plus diagonals), yielding an
  \emph{adjacent\_basin} edge set that mirrors the segmentation topology.
  \item \textbf{Edge weight.} Small-angle centroid distance in degrees
  (longitude scaled by $\cos b$).
  \item \textbf{Outputs.}
  \texttt{telascura\_topo\_graph\_v1\_patch.json} (nodes+edges) and
  \texttt{topo\_edges\_patch.geojson} (centroid--centroid LineStrings for GIS).
\end{enumerate}

\paragraph*{How to run.}
\begin{verbatim}
python gen_topo_graph_patch.py
\end{verbatim}

\paragraph*{Script used.}
\begin{lstlisting}[language=Python,caption={\texttt{gen\_topo\_graph\_patch.py}},label={lst:gen_topo_graph_patch}]
#!/usr/bin/env python3
# Build a Telascura graph (v1) from the patched topological products.
# Inputs: topo_nodes_patch.csv, topo_label_grid_patch.npz
# Outputs: telascura_topo_graph_v1_patch.json, topo_edges_patch.geojson
# ASCII-only.

import json
import argparse
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

DEF_NODES_CSV = "topo_nodes_patch.csv"
DEF_NPZ       = "topo_label_grid_patch.npz"
DEF_OUT_JSON  = "telascura_topo_graph_v1_patch.json"
DEF_OUT_GJ    = "topo_edges_patch.geojson"

def parse_args():
    p = argparse.ArgumentParser(
        description="Build Telascura topo graph v1 (adjacency from label grid)."
    )
    p.add_argument("--nodes", default=DEF_NODES_CSV)
    p.add_argument("--npz",   default=DEF_NPZ)
    p.add_argument("--out-json", default=DEF_OUT_JSON)
    p.add_argument("--out-geojson", default=DEF_OUT_GJ)
    return p.parse_args()

def centroid_dist_deg(a_l, a_b, b_l, b_b):
    # small-angle distance in deg (scale l by cos of mean b)
    b_mean = 0.5 * (a_b + b_b)
    dl = (a_l - b_l) * np.cos(np.deg2rad(b_mean))
    db = (a_b - b_b)
    return float(np.hypot(dl, db))

def unique_pairs_from_grid(labels):
    """Return sorted unique label pairs (a<b) that touch in the raster."""
    lab = labels.astype(np.int32)
    H, W = lab.shape
    pairs = []

    # horizontal neighbors
    a = lab[:, :-1]; b = lab[:, 1:]
    m = (a > 0) & (b > 0) & (a != b)
    if m.any():
        ab = np.stack([np.minimum(a,b), np.maximum(a,b)], axis=-1)[m]
        pairs.append(ab)

    # vertical neighbors
    a = lab[:-1, :]; b = lab[1:, :]
    m = (a > 0) & (b > 0) & (a != b)
    if m.any():
        ab = np.stack([np.minimum(a,b), np.maximum(a,b)], axis=-1)[m]
        pairs.append(ab)

    # diag down-right
    a = lab[:-1, :-1]; b = lab[1:, 1:]
    m = (a > 0) & (b > 0) & (a != b)
    if m.any():
        ab = np.stack([np.minimum(a,b), np.maximum(a,b)], axis=-1)[m]
        pairs.append(ab)

    # diag down-left
    a = lab[:-1, 1:]; b = lab[1:, :-1]
    m = (a > 0) & (b > 0) & (a != b)
    if m.any():
        ab = np.stack([np.minimum(a,b), np.maximum(a,b)], axis=-1)[m]
        pairs.append(ab)

    if not pairs:
        return []

    all_pairs = np.vstack(pairs)
    # deduplicate
    all_pairs = np.unique(all_pairs, axis=0)
    return [tuple(map(int, p)) for p in all_pairs]

def main():
    args = parse_args()

    nodes = pd.read_csv(args.nodes)
    z = np.load(args.npz)
    labels = z["labels"].astype(np.int32)

    # map numeric label -> ID ("T-Topo-XXXX" -> XXXX)
    label_to_id = {}
    for _, r in nodes.iterrows():
        try:
            labnum = int(str(r["ID"]).split("-")[-1])
            label_to_id[labnum] = str(r["ID"])
        except Exception:
            pass

    # adjacency from touching labels in the raster
    touching = unique_pairs_from_grid(labels)

    # build edges
    edges = []
    for a, b in touching:
        if a in label_to_id and b in label_to_id:
            u = label_to_id[a]; v = label_to_id[b]
            ra = nodes.loc[nodes["ID"] == u, ["l_mean","b_mean"]].values
            rb = nodes.loc[nodes["ID"] == v, ["l_mean","b_mean"]].values
            if len(ra)==1 and len(rb)==1:
                w = centroid_dist_deg(float(ra[0,0]), float(ra[0,1]),
                                      float(rb[0,0]), float(rb[0,1]))
                edges.append({"u":u, "v":v, "type":"adjacent_basin", "weight":w})

    # graph JSON
    graph = {
        "version": "telascura-map-v1",
        "nodes": [{
            "id": str(r["ID"]),
            "l": float(r["l_mean"]), "b": float(r["b_mean"]),
            "type": str(r["type"]),
            "area_deg2": float(r["area_deg2"]),
            "Nstars": float(r["Nstars"]),
            "K_mean": float(r["K_mean"]),
            "gradK_mean": float(r["gradK_mean"]),
            "persistence_G": float(r["persistence"]),
            "persistence_K": float(r["persistence_K"])
        } for _, r in nodes.iterrows()],
        "edges": edges,
        "meta": {
            "source": "topo_patch_segment_gradk.py",
            "adjacency": "touching pixels (4+diagonals)"
        }
    }

    with open(args.out_json, "w", encoding="utf-8") as f:
        json.dump(graph, f, indent=2)
    print("Saved graph:", args.out_json, "nodes:", len(graph["nodes"]), "edges:", len(edges))

    # edges GeoJSON (LineString between centroids)
    features = []
    for e in edges:
        ra = nodes.loc[nodes["ID"]==e["u"], ["l_mean","b_mean"]].values[0]
        rb = nodes.loc[nodes["ID"]==e["v"], ["l_mean","b_mean"]].values[0]
        features.append({
            "type":"Feature",
            "properties":{"u":e["u"],"v":e["v"],"weight":e["weight"]},
            "geometry":{"type":"LineString","coordinates":[[float(ra[0]),float(ra[1])],
                                                          [float(rb[0]),float(rb[1])]]}
        })
    gj = {"type":"FeatureCollection","features":features,
          "crs":{"type":"name","properties":{"name":"galactic_l_b_deg"}}}
    with open(args.out_geojson, "w", encoding="utf-8") as f:
        json.dump(gj, f)
    print("Saved edges GeoJSON:", args.out_geojson, "features:", len(features))

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
\end{lstlisting}

\subsection*{Why an edge list, and how we build it}

\noindent
The watershed segmentation on the gradient proxy produces a set of topological
basins (nodes) with centroids and per--basin attributes. To integrate these
objects into the global \emph{Telascura} map we also need a sparse set of
relationships between nodes. In this work we adopt a minimal, reproducible
definition of adjacency and build a graph layer:

\begin{enumerate}[leftmargin=*]
  \item \textbf{Inputs.} We use the patched products from the topological
  segmentation: the node catalog \texttt{topo\_nodes\_patch.csv} and the label grid
  \texttt{topo\_label\_grid\_patch.npz} (pixel labels after watershed).
  Each node carries an ID (\texttt{T-Topo-XXXX}), centroid \((l_{\text{mean}}, b_{\text{mean}})\),
  and metrics (area, counts, means, persistence).
  \item \textbf{Adjacency rule.} Two basins are considered neighbors if their
  integer labels touch in the raster (4--connected plus diagonals, i.e.\ 8--connected).
  From the label image we enumerate all touching pairs \((a,b)\) with \(a \neq b\),
  deduplicate, and map each integer label back to its node ID.
  \item \textbf{Edge weight.} For each adjacent pair we assign a distance--like
  weight equal to the small--angle centroid distance in degrees:
  \[
    \Delta l = (l_a - l_b)\,\cos\!\big(0.5\,(b_a + b_b)\big), \qquad
    \Delta b = (b_a - b_b), \qquad
    w = \sqrt{(\Delta l)^2 + (\Delta b)^2}.
  \]
  This captures centroid--to--centroid separation on the \((l,b)\) plane and is
  sufficient for ranking/visualization. (Great--circle distance can be used as a
  drop--in replacement if desired.)
  \item \textbf{Outputs.} We serialize a graph JSON
  \texttt{telascura\_topo\_graph\_v1\_patch.json} with fields
  \texttt{nodes}, \texttt{edges}, and \texttt{meta}, and a companion
  GeoJSON \texttt{topo\_edges\_patch.geojson} with \texttt{LineString}
  centroid--to--centroid segments for GIS and quick plots.
  For the paper table we also derive a compact CSV with the first 10 edges:
  \texttt{topo\_edges\_patch\_top10.csv}.
\end{enumerate}

\paragraph*{Reproducibility (how to run).}
All steps are scripted. From the working directory:
\begin{verbatim}
# 1) Build the graph (nodes + edges) from patched topo products
python gen_topo_graph_patch.py \
  --nodes topo_nodes_patch.csv \
  --npz   topo_label_grid_patch.npz \
  --out-json   telascura_topo_graph_v1_patch.json \
  --out-geojson topo_edges_patch.geojson

# 2) Create the small edge extract used by Table~\ref{tab:TopoEdgesPatch10}
python gen_topo_graph_patch_edges_top10.py
\end{verbatim}

\paragraph*{Notes and limitations.}
Adjacency is purely topological (touching pixels) and therefore depends on grid
resolution and smoothing adopted in the watershed step; the JSON \texttt{meta}
block records these settings. The weight \(w\) is a centroid metric; alternative
weights (e.g.\ persistence contrasts, membership overlap, or kinematic
alignment) can be added later as additional edge attributes without changing the
graph schema.



\newpage
\begin{table}[htbp]
  \centering
  \caption{First 10 edges from the Telascura topological graph (adjacent basins). Columns are source ($u$), target ($v$), and centroid--to--centroid distance in degrees.}
  \setlength{\tabcolsep}{6pt}
  \pgfplotstabletypeset[
    col sep=comma,
    columns={u,v,weight},
    columns/u/.style={string type, column name={$u$ (source)}},
    columns/v/.style={string type, column name={$v$ (target)}},
    columns/weight/.style={column name={distance [deg]}, fixed, precision=3},
    every head row/.style={before row=\toprule, after row=\midrule},
    every last row/.style={after row=\bottomrule}
  ]{topo_edges_patch_top10.csv}
  \label{tab:TopoEdgesPatch10}
\end{table}

\begin{lstlisting}[language=Python,caption={gen\_topo\_graph\_patch\_edges\_top10.py},label={lst:gen_topo_graph_patch10}]
# #!/usr/bin/env python3
# Extract first 10 edges (u, v, weight) from the v1 patch graph JSON.
# Input: telascura_topo_graph_v1_patch.json
# Output: topo_edges_patch_top10.csv  (ASCII-only)

import json
import pandas as pd

IN_JSON  = "telascura_topo_graph_v1_patch.json"
OUT_CSV  = "topo_edges_patch_top10.csv"
N_TAKE   = 10   # change if you want more rows

def main():
    with open(IN_JSON, "r", encoding="utf-8") as f:
        g = json.load(f)
    edges = g.get("edges", [])
    df = pd.DataFrame(edges)[["u", "v", "weight"]]
    # keep file order; if you prefer shortest edges, uncomment the next line:
    # df = df.sort_values("weight", ascending=True)
    df.head(N_TAKE).to_csv(OUT_CSV, index=False)
    print("Saved:", OUT_CSV, "rows:", min(N_TAKE, len(df)))

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

\end{lstlisting}

\paragraph*{Edge weights: variants and extensions.}
The default edge weight is the centroid--to--centroid separation
$w_{\text{dist}}$ on the $(l,b)$ plane. If needed, we can define composite
weights that also encode topological or kinematic contrasts while keeping the
schema unchanged:
\[
w = \alpha\,w_{\text{dist}} + \beta\,\Delta K_{\text{pers}} + \gamma\,\Delta G_{\text{pers}} ,
\]
where $\Delta K_{\text{pers}}$ and $\Delta G_{\text{pers}}$ are absolute
differences in persistence measured on $K$ and $G$ across the two incident
nodes. Coefficients $(\alpha,\beta,\gamma)$ can be tuned (or cross--validated)
per application. Additional options include: (i) inverse weights
$1/(1+w)$ for path finding; (ii) kinematic affinity from Sect.~\ref{tab:NodeKinematicCoherence}
(e.g.\ $1-\mathcal{C}$ across the pair) added as an extra term; (iii) membership
overlap if a star--level assignment to basins is available.

\paragraph*{Graph QC (summary).}
We report basic consistency checks for the topological graph: number of nodes and
edges, mean degree, number of connected components, and the size of the largest
component. These are generated by the script below.
